impDef.description: Whether the declared type of a regular result of a successful outcome of a GQL-request is exposed to the GQL-client.
The extent to which further GQL-status objects are chained.
The result of any operation other than a normalize function or a normalized predicate on an unnormalized character string.
The rules for determining the actual value of an approximate numeric type from its apparent value.
Whether rounding or truncating occurs when least significant digits are lost on assignment.
The choice of value selected when there is more than one approximation for a numeric type that conforms to the criteria for each supported type of numeric value.
Which supported numeric values other than exact numeric types also have approximations.
The boundaries within which the normal rules of arithmetic apply.
Whether rounding or truncating is used on division with an approximate mathematical result.
Whether a GQL Flagger flags implementation-defined features.
Whether the General Rules of Evaluation of a selective path pattern are terminated if an exception condition is raised.
Whether an exception condition is raised when the declared type of NULL cannot be determined contextually.
Whether to pad character strings for comparison, or not.
Whether to treat byte string differing only in right-most X'00' bytes as equal, or not.
Whether or not an exception condition is raised or an arbitrary value is chosen when multiple assignments to a graph element property are specified.
Whether ‹bidirectional control character›s are permitted in string literals.
Whether characters of the Unicode General Category class “Co” are permitted to be contained in the representative form of an identifier.
Whether an exception condition is raised, or truncation or rounding occurs, when an assignment of some number would result in a loss of its least significant digits.
The character (code) interpreted as newline.
The effect that additional values resulting from the support of Feature GA01, “IEEE 754 floating point operations” have on the processing of a GQL-request.
Whether a GQL-implementation supports leap seconds or discontinuities in calendars, and the consequences of such support for temporal arithmetic.
The object (principal) that represents a user within a GQL-implementation.
The association between a principal and its home schema and home graph.
The set of privileges identified by an authorization identifier.
The value types of inner elements of constructed values when no concrete value is specified.
The declared type of an ‹elements function›.
The default transaction characteristics.
The translations of condition texts.
The map of diagnostic information, if provided.
The default collation.
The preferred name of a string type, for each supported kind of string type.
The effective binary precision of each supported integer type.
The effective decimal precision of each decimal type.
The effective binary precision and scale of each supported approximate numeric type.
The default time zone displacement.
The default session parameters.
The exact numeric type with scale 0 (zero) of list element ordinal positions.
The exact numeric type with scale 0 (zero) of list element position offsets.
The exact numeric declared type of results of the COUNT function.
The declared type of SESSION_USER.
The exact numeric declared type of a non-negative integer specification.
The numeric declared type of the result of a dyadic arithmetic operator when either operand is approximate numeric.
The numeric declared type of the result of a dyadic arithmetic operator when both operands are exact numeric.
The precision of the result of addition and subtraction of exact numeric types.
The precision of the result of multiplication of exact numeric types.
The precision and scale of the result of division of exact numeric types.
The exact numeric declared type of results length expressions.
The numeric declared types of results of trigonometric functions, general logarithm functions, natural logarithms, exponential functions, and power functions.
The declared type of the result of a cardinality expression.
The precision of an exact numeric result of a numeric value expression.
The precision of an approximate numeric result of a numeric value expression.
The declared type of results of the ELEMENT_ID function.
The declared type of an approximate numeric literal.
The nullable declared type of NULL if its declared type cannot be determined contextually.
The default graph pattern match mode.
The use of GRAPH or PROPERTY GRAPH in the preferred name of graph types and graph reference value types.
The use of NODE or VERTEX in the preferred name of node types, node reference value types, and their base types.
The use of EDGE or RELATIONSHIP in the preferred name of edge types, edge reference value types, and their base types.
The exact numeric declared types of the results of the SUM function.
The exact numeric declared types of the results of the AVG function.
The approximate numeric declared types of the results of the SUM and AVG functions.
The approximate numeric declared types of the results of the STDDEV_POP and STDDEV_SAMP functions.
The approximate numeric declared types of the results of binary set functions.
The object, resource, or value identified by a URI or a URL.
The levels of transaction isolation, their interactions, their granularity of application and the Format and Syntax Rules for ‹implementation-defined access mode› used to select them.
The UAX31-R1-1 profile if used.
Relaxations of the assumption of serializable transactional behavior, if any.
The treatment of language that does not conform to the Formats and Syntax Rules.
Additional restrictions, requirements, and conditions imposed on mixed-mode transactions.
The conditions raised when the requirements on mixed-mode transactions are violated.
Additional conditions for which a completion condition warning (01000) is raised.
Additional informational conditions raised.
The subclasses providing information of a non-cautionary nature when the completion condition is successful completion.
The minimum and maximum cardinalities of label sets, for each kind of graph element.
The maximum cardinalities of property sets, for each kind of graph element.
The minimum and maximum cardinalities of key label sets, for each kind of graph element.
The minimum length of a string resulting from string concatenation of strings of variable-length string types, for each supported string type.
The maximum number of digits permitted in an unsigned integer literal.
The maximum precision and scale of numbers of numeric types, for each supported kind of number.
The maximum lengths of string values of string types, for each supported string type.
The maximum cardinality of constructed values, for each supported constructed value type.
The maximum value of the upper bound of a general qualifier.
The maximum depth of nesting of GQL-directories.
The minimum and maximum values of the exponent for an approximate numeric type.
The maximum value of fractional seconds precision for a temporal instant or a temporal duration.
The implicit ordering of NULLs.
The character repertoire of GQL source text.
The result of an inequality comparison between operands that are essentially comparable values when not otherwise specified.
The choice of the normal form of each supported kind of GQL-object type with a defined normal form.
The choice of the normal form of each supported kind of value type with a defined normal form.
The result of a comparison between two operands that are universally comparable values.
The dynamic union type chosen as the dynamic property value type.
The set of component types of the open dynamic union type.
The set of value types that includes at least one supertype of every static value type supported by the GQL-implementation.
The valid syntactic representation of an authorization identifier.
The description of any additional text provided about conditions.
The set of characters included in truncating whitespace.
The mechanism for instructing a GQL-client to create and destroy GQL-sessions to GQL-servers, and to submit GQL-requests to them.
The mechanism for creating and destroying authorization identifiers, and their mapping to principals.
The mechanism for determining when the last request has been received.
The alternative mechanism for starting and terminating transactions.
The mechanism by which termination success or failure statuses are made available to the GQL-agent or administrator.
The mechanism for determining the dictionary of GQL-request parameters.
The manner in which GQL-status objects are presented to a GQL-client.
The manner in which external procedures are provided.
The mechanism for determining the reference value type of an element variable declared by a graph pattern.
The mechanism for determining the reference value type of an element variable declared by insert node pattern.
The mechanism used to determine if two character strings are visually confusable with each other.
The manner, if it so chooses, in which a GQL-implementation automatically creates and populates a GQL-directory.
The manner, if it so chooses, in which a GQL-implementation automatically populates a GQL-schema upon its creation.
The manner in which the result of the concatenation of non-normalized character strings is determined.
The manner in which lax casts (and supporting type tests) are generated and included in the syntax transforms for the dynamic generation of strict casts.
The mechanism for determining a common supertype of a set of value types of the same primary static base type.
The mechanism for determining a permutation of all value types of a set of value types that adheres to type precedence rules.
The mechanism for determining if the null value is not actually going to be assigned to a site.
The mechanism for determining the canonical name form of a ‹delimited identifier› or ‹non-delimited identifier›.
The mechanism for determining which and how many catalog-modifying procedures are under transaction control, and which catalog-modifying procedures can be contained in a single transaction.
